choices.A: The Services field prevents SNAT and DNAT from being combined in the same policy.
choices.D: The Services field prevents multiple sources of traffic from using multiple services to connect to a single computer.
choices.B: The Services field is used when you need to bundle several VIPs into VIP groups.
choices.C: The Services field removes the requirement to create multiple VIPs for different services.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct

choices.D: To allow for out-of-order packets that could arrive after the FIN/ACK packets

questions.question_text: Why does FortiGate keep TCP sessions in the session table for several seconds, even after both sides (client and server) have terminated the session?

choices.C: All requests not sent to fortinet.com or the 172.25.120.0/24 subnet, have to go through altproxy.corp.com: 8060.
choices.D: Any web request sent to fortinet.com is allowed to bypass the proxy.
choices.A: Browsers can be configured to retrieve this PAC file from FortiGate.
choices.B: Any web request sent to the 172.25.120.0/24 subnet is allowed to bypass the proxy.

discussion.content: AD is correct. The command direct bypass the proxy and it is a standard for pac files. And browsers can download de pac file from any server/fortigate.
B & C is not correct hence A & D are correct :-)

choices.C: It recommends the use of dynamic routing protocols, so that spokes can learn the routes to other spokes.
choices.B: ADVPN is supported only with IKEv2.
choices.A: IPSec tunnels are negotiated dynamically between spokes.
choices.D: Every spoke requires a static tunnel to be configured to other spokes, so that phase 1 and phase 2 proposals are defined in advance.

discussion.content:
A and C are correct
Fortigate_ Infrastructure_209
A & C are correct - Enterprise_FW_Manual-6.2, p. 457-458
